image.altText: White hail scattered on the ground seen through a car window on a rainy day

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology reported Adelaide recorded a maximum of 19.7C on Christmas Day while hail was reported in parts of South Australia.

title.children: Coldest Christmas Day in Adelaide in 17 years as the rest of SA had below average temperatures

image.altText: Water floods a Shell service station in Welshpool, Gippsland.

props.synopsis: Much of the east coast has begun a clean-up after a night of flooding and storms, while five people are missing in south-east Queensland.

title.children: Girl lost in flooded storm drain among five missing as wild storms lash Australia's east coast

image.altText: Smoke coming from behind trees in WA's outback

props.synopsis: WA Police are investigating the death of a volunteer firefighter responding to a blaze in the Shire of Esperance in the state's south.

title.children: 'Absolute tragedy': Volunteer firefighter dies while responding to Boxing Day blaze on WA's south coast

image.altText: Emergency crews are stationed next to Penrith Beach.

props.synopsis: A missing swimmer's body has been found by emergency services at the newly-opened Penrith Beach in Sydney's west following reports he fell off a paddleboard and failed to resurface.

title.children: Emergency services discover missing swimmer's body at the newly-opened Penrith Beach

image.altText: A boat making its way through waves

props.synopsis: Andoo Comanche is leading late on day one of the Sydney to Hobart, but one of its main challengers may have hit trouble, with SHK Scallywag losing ground.

title.children: Sydney to Hobart race favourite SHK Scallywag one of the first casualties as Andoo Comanche takes the lead

image.altText: Rusting cars with smashed windscreens among tropical palms.

props.synopsis: How does a pristine tropical island manage decades of rubbish? For one of Australia's most remote territories, it can be an expensive ordeal.

title.children: What does a pristine tropical island do with decades worth of dumped cars?

image.altText: A woman in a pink jumper holds a bunch of toilet paper rolls

props.synopsis: As we enter the festive season it's a good time to think about what all those celebratory alcoholic drinks can do to your gut, writes Vincent Ho.

title.children: Why does alcohol make my poo go weird?

image.altText: Lightning strikes

props.synopsis: A woman has been killed after severe storms ripped through parts of south-east Queensland last night, with more storms forecast to hit the state this week.

title.children: Concrete powerlines taken down for the first time in unprecedented south-east Queensland 'mini cyclone'

image.altText: A young girl wearing a spacesuit costume and helmet stands in a field of purple flowers under an overcast sky

props.synopsis: Andrew Rovenko's otherworldly photographs of his daughter wearing an astronaut costume attracted fans from all over the world — and now feature in a coffee-table book.

title.children: Tired of baking sourdough, this Melbourne family began an unusual lockdown project — that went viral

image.altText: Marnus Labuschagne chases pigeons

props.synopsis: Pakistan dropped catches, David Warner offered them up and the crowd celebrated Shane Warne's fabulous legacy on Boxing Day at the MCG. Here are the five quick hits from day one.

title.children: Five quick hits — A shocking error, some unexpected beef and Shane Warne's legacy at the MCG

image.altText: Pakistan bowler Shaheen Shah Afridi puts his hands to his mouth after bowling to Australia batter Usman Khawaja.

props.synopsis: Whether it's within an over or a session, Australia's batters are able to simply wait out the good stuff from Pakistan, safe in the knowledge the pressure will be released before too long.

title.children: Touring Pakistan needs to learn from its hosts, even if it's boring sometimes

image.altText: A man playing ice hockey

props.synopsis: When Adam Johnson died during an ice hockey match earlier this year, his club called it a "freak accident". Now police are investigating whether another player could have been criminally responsible.

title.children: A player's brutal death on the ice hockey rink has left a UK team devastated and police in tricky territory

image.altText: Silhouettes of people dancing in a nightclub bathed in red light.

props.synopsis: This was the year we got shock and more. While 2023 saw continued freedom from COVID lockdowns and rules, a cost-of-living crisis and an ever-growing crunch in housing put substantial curbs on our lives and choices.

title.children: Was 2023 the year that the class cracks in Australia's economy opened into gaping chasms?

image.altText: Boxing Day sales 2023 Melbourne 2023-12-26 11:12:00

props.synopsis: Despite cost-of-living pressures, Aussies are expected to spend more than they did at last year's Boxing Day Sales.

title.children: Australians tipped to spend $23.9 billion as thousands flock to Boxing Day Sales

image.altText: People working in an old style General Store

props.synopsis: The general store at Cumnock in western New South Wales has had five owners over its 141-year history. Now it has a sixth: the town itself.

title.children: Small town buys 141-year-old general store to save it from closure

image.altText: a police car and van and police tape next to a house

props.synopsis: A woman in her 30s dies after being found with serious injuries in the Kimberley town, while a man assists police with their inquiries.

title.children: Homicide detectives investigate woman's death in Broome on Christmas night

image.altText: A sign in a garden with trees and houses behind it reads Woorabinda.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating a house fire in the Indigenous community of Woorabinda.

title.children: Man found dead in house fire in Central Queensland as police launch investigation

image.altText: A woman sits on the floor, leaning against a couch, using a laptop

props.synopsis: It may not be enough simply to be physically away from work, particularly in an era when so many of us work from home. We also have to stop thinking about work when we're not there, writes Jane Gifkins.

title.children: The secret to switching off from work lies in learning the art of detachment

image.altText: Two children walk past rubble at a refugee camp in central Gaza strip

props.synopsis: Benjamin Netanyahu says Israel's war against Hamas is far from over, dismissing what he describes as media speculation that his government might call a halt to the fighting.

title.children: Israeli PM vows no let-up in war but UN official says Gazans have no place to go

image.altText: A man holds an umbrella with his back to the camera, overlooking a beach with a city in the background.

props.synopsis: It's muggy, you've got a week off work, and you're desperate to make the most of it with plenty of ocean swims. If it bucketed down yesterday, can you still go in?

title.children: The dangers of swimming in oceans, rivers or waterholes after rain

image.altText: Copperlode Dam in far north Queensland.

props.synopsis: Cairns' mayor estimates that the city was two hours away from losing its water supply during last week's torrential rain, bringing to the fore the city's urgent need to upgrade its water supply.

title.children: Booming population, damaged infrastructure has Cairns seeking funding to shore up water supply

image.altText: Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny is seen on a screen via video link from a penal colony.

props.synopsis: Mr Navalny was tracked down after supporters lost touch with him for more than two weeks.

title.children: Jailed Russian opposition politician Alexei Navalny moved to prison in the Arctic

image.altText: A woman in a chequered shirt is reaching for a parcel. A young woman in a pink cap is looking at the parcel.

props.synopsis: With pine cones in the fireplace, antique clocks, and fresh flowers, the Loch post office has become a beloved community meeting place in country Victoria.

title.children: Volunteers with eye for antique style turn post office into 'heartbeat' of rural town

image.altText: group of women wearing colorful dresses and performing a traditional Indian dance

props.synopsis: In a spectacular display, tens of thousands of women wearing bright red and green colours in India's Gujarat state gather to perform the traditional 'Raas' dance to mark a two-day spiritual festival.

title.children: Preserving the tradition, thousands of Indian women dance in a festival of colour

image.altText: A plane taking off from the tarmac

props.synopsis: Following an anonymous tip-off, French authorities grounded a plane to conduct investigations over four days which affected 303 passengers.

title.children: Flight grounded for four days in France, amid human trafficking concerns, flies to India

image.altText: People waiting in line outside Grill'd Perth CBD.

props.synopsis: Something as simple as a hot meal often becomes a luxury when you are sleeping rough. But for one night a month, those doing it tough are being invited to enjoy a burger on the house.

title.children: Free burger initiative offering Perth's growing community of rough sleepers much more than a hot dinner

image.altText: A little girl and her family wearing puffy coats jumps in the air outside a large christmas tree in front of a church

props.synopsis: A cold wave envelops northern and central swathes of China, bringing snow storms and record-breaking temperatures.

title.children: Beijing records longest period of sub-freezing temperatures in 72 years

image.altText: A tall man and a woman walking along a dusty road

props.synopsis: From dusty farming communities to sleepy seaside towns, crime fiction set in regional Australia is taking off. Here's why readers are devouring these stories.

title.children: 'A narrow world': Why a small country town is the perfect setting for crime fiction
